intro: Dissotidendron johnstonianum var. johnstonianum, commonly known as the Johnston's dissotidendron, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is a shrub characterized by its branched structure and small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological adaptation to extreme environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
